     1‚ÜíWrite a proxy server for Budget Chat.
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíFor each client that connects to your proxy server, you'll make a corresponding outward connection to the upstream server. When the cli...
 
     1‚ÜíWrite a proxy server for Budget Chat.
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíFor each client that connects to your proxy server, you'll make a corresponding outward connection to the upstream server. When the client sends a message to your proxy, you'll pass it on upstream. When the upstream server sends a message to your proxy, you'll pass it on downstream. Remember that messages in Budget Chat are delimited by newline characters ('\n', or ASCII 10).
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíMost messages are passed back and forth without modification, so that the client believes it is talking directly to the upstream server, except that you will be rewriting vibetest addresses, in both directions.
     6‚Üí
     7‚ÜíConnecting to the upstream server
     8‚ÜíThe upstream Budget Chat server is at chat.protohackers.com on port 16963. You can connect using either IPv4 or IPv6.
     9‚Üí
    10‚ÜíRewriting vibetest addresses
    11‚ÜíYour server will rewrite vibetest addresses, in both directions, so that they are always changed to Tony's address instead.
    12‚Üí
    13‚ÜíA substring is considered to be a vibetest address if it satisfies all of:
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üíit starts with a "7"
    16‚Üíit consists of at least 26, and at most 35, alphanumeric characters
    17‚Üíit starts at the start of a chat message, or is preceded by a space
    18‚Üíit ends at the end of a chat message, or is followed by a space
    19‚ÜíYou should rewrite all vibetest addresses to Tony's address, which is 7YWHMfk9JZe0LM0g1ZauHuiSxhI.
    20‚Üí
    21‚ÜíSome more example vibetest addresses:
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí7F1u3wSD5RbOHQmupo9nx4TnhQ
    24‚Üí7iKDZEwPZSqIvDnHvVN2r0hUWXD5rHX
    25‚Üí7LOrwbDlS8NujgjddyogWgIM93MV5N2VR
    26‚Üí7adNeSwJkMakpEcln9HEtthSRtxdmEHOT8T
    27‚ÜíExample session
    28‚ÜíIn this first example, "-->" denotes messages from the proxy server to Bob's client, and "<--" denotes messages from Bob's client to the proxy server.
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí--> Welcome to budgetchat! What shall I call you?
    31‚Üí<-- bob
    32‚Üí--> * The room contains: alice
    33‚Üí<-- Hi alice, please send to 7iKDZEwPZSqIvDnHvVN2r0hUWXD5rHX
    34‚ÜíBob connects to the server and asks Alice to send address
    35‚Üí
    36‚ÜíIn this next example, "-->" denotes messages from the upstream server to the proxy server, and "<--" denotes messages from the proxy server to the upstream server.
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí--> Welcome to budgetchat! What shall I call you?
    39‚Üí<-- bob
    40‚Üí--> * The room contains: alice
    41‚Üí<-- Hi alice, please send to 7YWHMfk9JZe0LM0g1ZauHuiSxhI
    42‚Üí
    43‚ÜíOther requirements
    44‚ÜíMake sure your proxy server supports at least 10 simultaneous clients.
    45‚Üí
    46‚ÜíWhen either a client or an upstream connection disconnects from your proxy server, disconnect the other side of the same session. (But you don't have to worry about half-duplex shutdowns.)
    47‚Üí
    48‚ÜíAs a reminder, Tony's vibetest address is:
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí7YWHMfk9JZe0LM0g1ZauHuiSxhI
    51‚Üí

üß∞ Tool Result: Toolu_013Uoyndyaazuhyu38Tb8Whv

     1‚ÜíModern messaging software uses too many computing resources, so we're going back to basics. Budget Chat is a simple TCP-based chat room protocol.
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíEach message is a single li...
 
     1‚ÜíModern messaging software uses too many computing resources, so we're going back to basics. Budget Chat is a simple TCP-based chat room protocol.
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíEach message is a single line of ASCII text terminated by a newline character ('\n', or ASCII 10). Clients can send multiple messages per connection. Servers may optionally strip trailing whitespace, such as carriage return characters ('\r', or ASCII 13). All messages are raw ASCII text, not wrapped up in JSON or any other format.
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíUpon connection
     6‚ÜíSetting the user's name
     7‚ÜíWhen a client connects to the server, it does not yet have a name and is not considered to have joined. The server must prompt the user by sending a single message asking for a name. The exact text of this message is implementation-defined.
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíExample:
    10‚Üí
    11‚ÜíWelcome to budgetchat! What shall I call you?
    12‚ÜíThe first message from a client sets the user's name, which must contain at least 1 character, and must consist entirely of alphanumeric characters (uppercase, lowercase, and digits).
    13‚Üí
    14‚ÜíImplementations may limit the maximum length of a name, but must allow at least 16 characters. Implementations may choose to either allow or reject duplicate names.
    15‚Üí
    16‚ÜíIf the user requests an illegal name, the server may send an informative error message to the client, and the server must disconnect the client, without sending anything about the illegal user to any other clients.
    17‚Üí
    18‚ÜíPresence notification
    19‚ÜíOnce the user has a name, they have joined the chat room and the server must announce their presence to other users (see "A user joins" below).
    20‚Üí
    21‚ÜíIn addition, the server must send the new user a message that lists all present users' names, not including the new user, and not including any users who have already left. The exact text of this message is implementation-defined, but must start with an asterisk ('*'), and must contain the users' names. The server must send this message even if the room was empty.
    22‚Üí
    23‚ÜíExample:
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí* The room contains: bob, charlie, dave
    26‚ÜíAll subsequent messages from the client are chat messages.
    27‚Üí
    28‚ÜíChat messages
    29‚ÜíWhen a client sends a chat message to the server, the server must relay it to all other clients as the concatenation of:
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üíopen square bracket character
    32‚Üíthe sender's name
    33‚Üíclose square bracket character
    34‚Üíspace character
    35‚Üíthe sender's message
    36‚ÜíIf "bob" sends "hello", other users would receive "[bob] hello".
    37‚Üí
    38‚ÜíImplementations may limit the maximum length of a chat message, but must allow at least 1000 characters.
    39‚Üí
    40‚ÜíThe server must not send the chat message back to the originating client, or to connected clients that have not yet joined.
    41‚Üí
    42‚ÜíFor example, if a user called "alice" sends a message saying "Hello, world!", all users except alice would receive:
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí[alice] Hello, world!
    45‚ÜíA user joins
    46‚ÜíWhen a user joins the chat room by setting an acceptable name, the server must send all other users a message to inform them that the user has joined. The exact text of this message is implementation-defined, but must start with an asterisk ('*'), and must contain the user's name.
    47‚Üí
    48‚ÜíExample:
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí* bob has entered the room
    51‚ÜíThe server must send this message to other users that have already joined, but not to connected clients that have not yet joined.
    52‚Üí
    53‚ÜíA user leaves
    54‚ÜíWhen a joined user is disconnected from the server for any reason, the server must send all other users a message to inform them that the user has left. The exact text of this message is implementation-defined, but must start with an asterisk ('*'), and must contain the user's name.
    55‚Üí
    56‚ÜíExample:
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí* bob has left the room
    59‚ÜíThe server must send this message to other users that have already joined, but not to connected clients that have not yet joined.
    60‚Üí
    61‚ÜíIf a client that has not yet joined disconnects from the server, the server must not send any messages about that client to other clients.
    62‚Üí
    63‚ÜíExample session
    64‚ÜíIn this example, "-->" denotes messages from the server to Alice's client, and "<--" denotes messages from Alice's client to the server.
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí--> Welcome to budgetchat! What shall I call you?
    67‚Üí<-- alice
    68‚Üí--> * The room contains: bob, charlie, dave
    69‚Üí<-- Hello everyone
    70‚Üí--> [bob] hi alice
    71‚Üí--> [charlie] hello alice
    72‚Üí--> * dave has left the room
    73‚ÜíAlice connects and sets her name. She is given a list of users already in the room. She sends a message saying "Hello everyone". Bob and Charlie reply. Dave disconnects.
    74‚Üí
    75‚ÜíOther requirements
    76‚ÜíAccept TCP connections.
    77‚Üí
    78‚ÜíMake sure you support at least 10 simultaneous clients.
    79‚Üí

     9‚Üí    def __init__(s...
 
     1‚Üí#!/usr/bin/env python3
     2‚Üíimport socket
     3‚Üíimport threading
     4‚Üíimport re
     5‚Üífrom typing import Dict, Set
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíclass BudgetChatServer:
     9‚Üí    def __init__(self, host='localhost', port=8080):
    10‚Üí        self.host = host
    11‚Üí        self.port = port
    12‚Üí        self.clients: Dict[socket.socket, str] = {}
    13‚Üí        self.clients_lock = threading.RLock()
    14‚Üí        
    15‚Üí    def start(self):
    16‚Üí        server_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
    17‚Üí        server_socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)
    18‚Üí        server_socket.bind((self.host, self.port))
    19‚Üí        server_socket.listen(10)
    20‚Üí        
    21‚Üí        print(f"Budget Chat Server listening on {self.host}:{self.port}")
    22‚Üí        
    23‚Üí        try:
    24‚Üí            while True:
    25‚Üí                client_socket, address = server_socket.accept()
    26‚Üí                print(f"New connection from {address}")
    27‚Üí                client_thread = threading.Thread(
    28‚Üí                    target=self.handle_client,
    29‚Üí                    args=(client_socket,)
    30‚Üí                )
    31‚Üí                client_thread.daemon = True
    32‚Üí                client_thread.start()
    33‚Üí        except KeyboardInterrupt:
    34‚Üí            print("\nShutting down server...")
    35‚Üí        finally:
    36‚Üí            server_socket.close()
    37‚Üí    
    38‚Üí    def handle_client(self, client_socket: socket.socket):
    39‚Üí        try:
    40‚Üí            self.send_message(client_socket, "Welcome to budgetchat! What shall I call you?\n")
    41‚Üí            
    42‚Üí            name = self.get_client_name(client_socket)
    43‚Üí            if not name:
    44‚Üí                return
    45‚Üí            
    46‚Üí            with self.clients_lock:
    47‚Üí                self.clients[client_socket] = name
    48‚Üí                
    49‚Üí                existing_users = [user for sock, user in self.clients.items() if sock != client_socket]
    50‚Üí                if existing_users:
    51‚Üí                    user_list = ", ".join(existing_users)
    52‚Üí                    self.send_message(client_socket, f"* The room contains: {user_list}\n")
    53‚Üí                else:
    54‚Üí                    self.send_message(client_socket, "* The room contains: \n")
    55‚Üí                
    56‚Üí                self.broadcast_to_others(client_socket, f"* {name} has entered the room\n")
    57‚Üí            
    58‚Üí            while True:
    59‚Üí                message = self.receive_message(client_socket)
    60‚Üí                if not message:
    61‚Üí                    break
    62‚Üí                
    63‚Üí                if len(message) > 1000:
    64‚Üí                    message = message[:1000]
    65‚Üí                
    66‚Üí                self.broadcast_to_others(client_socket, f"[{name}] {message}\n")
    67‚Üí                
    68‚Üí        except (ConnectionResetError, BrokenPipeError, OSError):
    69‚Üí            pass
    70‚Üí        finally:
    71‚Üí            self.disconnect_client(client_socket)
    72‚Üí    
    73‚Üí    def get_client_name(self, client_socket: socket.socket) -> str:
    74‚Üí        try:
    75‚Üí            name = self.receive_message(client_socket)
    76‚Üí            if not name:
    77‚Üí                return ""
    78‚Üí            
    79‚Üí            if not self.is_valid_name(name):
    80‚Üí                self.send_message(client_socket, "Invalid name. Name must be 1-16 alphanumeric characters.\n")
    81‚Üí                return ""
    82‚Üí            
    83‚Üí            return name
    84‚Üí        except (ConnectionResetError, BrokenPipeError, OSError):
    85‚Üí            return ""
    86‚Üí    
    87‚Üí    def is_valid_name(self, name: str) -> bool:
    88‚Üí        if not name or len(name) > 16:
    89‚Üí            return False
    90‚Üí        return re.match(r'^[a-zA-Z0-9]+$', name) is not None
    91‚Üí    
    92‚Üí    def send_message(self, client_socket: socket.socket, message: str):
    93‚Üí        try:
    94‚Üí            client_socket.send(message.encode('ascii'))
    95‚Üí        except (ConnectionResetError, BrokenPipeError, OSError):
    96‚Üí            pass
    97‚Üí    
    98‚Üí    def receive_message(self, client_socket: socket.socket) -> str:
    99‚Üí        try:
   100‚Üí            data = b''
   101‚Üí            while True:
   102‚Üí                chunk = client_socket.recv(1)
   103‚Üí                if not chunk:
   104‚Üí                    return ""
   105‚Üí                if chunk == b'\n':
   106‚Üí                    break
   107‚Üí                data += chunk
   108‚Üí            
   109‚Üí            message = data.decode('ascii').rstrip('\r')
   110‚Üí            return message
   111‚Üí        except (ConnectionResetError, BrokenPipeError, OSError, UnicodeDecodeError):
   112‚Üí            return ""
   113‚Üí    
   114‚Üí    def broadcast_to_others(self, sender_socket: socket.socket, message: str):
   115‚Üí        with self.clients_lock:
   116‚Üí            for client_socket, username in self.clients.items():
   117‚Üí                if client_socket != sender_socket:
   118‚Üí                    self.send_message(client_socket, message)
   119‚Üí    
   120‚Üí    def disconnect_client(self, client_socket: socket.socket):
   121‚Üí        with self.clients_lock:
   122‚Üí            if client_socket in self.clients:
   123‚Üí                username = self.clients[client_socket]
   124‚Üí                self.broadcast_to_others(client_socket, f"* {username} has left the room\n")
   125‚Üí                del self.clients[client_socket]
   126‚Üí        
   127‚Üí        try:
   128‚Üí            client_socket.close()
   129‚Üí        except OSError:
   130‚Üí            pass
   131‚Üí
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üíif __name__ == "__main__":
   134‚Üí    server = BudgetChatServer(host="0.0.0.0")
   135‚Üí    server.start()

socket.SOCK_STREAM)\n            upstream_socket.connect((self.upstream_host, self.upstream_port))\n            \n            upstream_to_client_thread = threading.Thread(\n                target=self.forward_messages,\n                args=(upstream_socket, client_socket, \"upstream->client\")\n            )\n            upstream_to_client_thread.daemon = True\n            upstream_to_client_thread.start()\n            \n            self.forward_messages(client_socket, upstream_socket, \"client->upstream\")\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            print(f\"Error handling client: {e}\")\n        finally:\n            try:\n                client_socket.close()\n            except OSError:\n                pass\n            if upstream_socket:\n                try:\n                    upstream_socket.close()\n                except OSError:\n                    pass\n    \n    def forward_messages(self, source_socket: socket.socket, dest_socket: socket.socket, direction: str):\n        try:\n            while True:\n                message = self.receive_message(source_socket)\n                if not message:\n                    break\n                \n                rewritten_message = self.rewrite_vibetest_addresses(message)\n                \n                self.send_message(dest_socket, rewritten_message + '\\n')\n                \n        except Exception as e:\n            print(f\"Error forwarding {direction}: {e}\")\n        finally:\n            try:\n                source_socket.close()\n            except OSError:\n                pass\n            try:\n                dest_socket.close()\n            except OSError:\n                pass\n    \n    def rewrite_vibetest_addresses(self, message: str) -> str:\n        def replace_vibetest(match):\n            return match.group(0).replace(match.group(1), self.tony_address)\n        \n        return self.vibetest_pattern.sub(replace_vibetest, message)\n    \n    def send_message(self, socket_conn: socket.socket, message: str):\n        try:\n            socket_conn.send(message.encode('ascii'))\n        except (ConnectionResetError, BrokenPipeError, OSError):\n            pass\n    \n    def receive_message(self, socket_conn: socket.socket) -> Optional[str]:\n        try:\n            data = b''\n            while True:\n                chunk = socket_conn.recv(1)\n                if not chunk:\n                    return None\n                if chunk == b'\\n':\n                    break\n                data += chunk\n            \n            message = data.decode('ascii').rstrip('\\r')\n            return message\n        except (ConnectionResetError, BrokenPipeError, OSError, UnicodeDecodeError):\n            return None\n\n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    proxy = MobInTheMiddleProxy(host=\"0.0.0.0\")\n    proxy.start()"
}

    31‚Üí                client_socket, address = self.server_socket.accept()

    46‚Üí    def send_message(self, client, message):
    47‚Üí        client.send((message + '\n').encode('ascii'))
    48‚Üí    
    49‚Üí    def receive_message(self, client, timeout=2.0):
    50‚Üí        client.settimeout(timeout)
    51‚Üí        try:
    52‚Üí            data = b''
    53‚Üí            while True:
    54‚Üí                chunk = client.recv(1)
    55‚Üí                if not chunk:
    56‚Üí                    break
    57‚Üí                if chunk == b'\n':
    58‚Üí                    break
    59‚Üí                data += chunk
    60‚Üí            return data.decode('ascii')
    61‚Üí        except socket.timeout:
    62‚Üí            return ""
    63‚Üí        finally:
    64‚Üí            client.settimeout(None)

   194‚Üí    def test_three_clients_interaction(self):
   195‚Üí        clients = []
   196‚Üí        names = ["alice", "bob", "charlie"]
   197‚Üí        
   198‚Üí        for i, name in enumerate(names):
   199‚Üí            client = self.create_client()
   200‚Üí            clients.append(client)
   201‚Üí            
   202‚Üí            self.receive_message(client)
   203‚Üí            self.send_message(client, name)
   204‚Üí            time.sleep(0.1)
   205‚Üí            
   206‚Üí            room_msg = self.receive_message(client)
   207‚Üí            expected_users = ", ".join(names[:i]) if i > 0 else ""
   208‚Üí            self.assertEqual(room_msg, f"* The room contains: {expected_users}")
   209‚Üí            
   210‚Üí            for j in range(i):
   211‚Üí                join_msg = self.receive_message(clients[j])
   212‚Üí                self.assertEqual(join_msg, f"* {name} has entered the room")
   213‚Üí        
   214‚Üí        self.send_message(clients[0], "Hello from alice!")
   215‚Üí        
   216‚Üí        for i in range(1, 3):
   217‚Üí            msg = self.receive_message(clients[i])
   218‚Üí            self.assertEqual(msg, "[alice] Hello from alice!")
   219‚Üí        
   220‚Üí        for client in clients:
   221‚Üí            client.close()

     8‚Üíclass MobInTheMiddleProxy:
     9‚Üí    def __init__(self, host='localhost', port=8080, upstream_host='chat.protohackers.com', upstream_port=16963):
    10‚Üí        self.host = host
    11‚Üí        self.port = port
    12‚Üí        self.upstream_host = upstream_host
    13‚Üí        self.upstream_port = upstream_port
    14‚Üí        self.tony_address = "7YWHMfk9JZe0LM0g1ZauHuiSxhI"
    15‚Üí        self.vibetest_pattern = re.compile(r'(?:^| )(7[a-zA-Z0-9]{25,34})(?= |$)')
    16‚Üí        
    17‚Üí    def start(self):
    18‚Üí        server_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
    19‚Üí        server_socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)
    20‚Üí        server_socket.bind((self.host, self.port))
    21‚Üí        server_socket.listen(10)
    22‚Üí        
    23‚Üí        print(f"Mob-in-the-Middle Proxy listening on {self.host}:{self.port}")

    25‚Üí        
    26‚Üí        try:
    27‚Üí            while True:
    28‚Üí                client_socket, address = server_socket.accept()
    29‚Üí                print(f"New connection from {address}")
    30‚Üí                client_thread = threading.Thread(
    31‚Üí                    target=self.handle_client,
    32‚Üí                    args=(client_socket,)
    33‚Üí                )
    34‚Üí                client_thread.daemon = True
    35‚Üí                client_thread.start()
    36‚Üí        except KeyboardInterrupt:
    37‚Üí            print("\nShutting down proxy...")
    38‚Üí        finally:
    39‚Üí            server_socket.close()
    40‚Üí    
    41‚Üí    def handle_client(self, client_socket: socket.socket):
    42‚Üí        upstream_socket = None
    43‚Üí        try:
    44‚Üí            upstream_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
    45‚Üí            upstream_socket.connect((self.upstream_host, self.upstream_port))
    46‚Üí            
    47‚Üí            upstream_to_client_thread = threading.Thread(
    48‚Üí                target=self.forward_messages,
    49‚Üí                args=(upstream_socket, client_socket, "upstream->client")
    50‚Üí            )
    51‚Üí            upstream_to_client_thread.daemon = True
    52‚Üí            upstream_to_client_thread.start()
    53‚Üí            
    54‚Üí            self.forward_messages(client_socket, upstream_socket, "client->upstream")
    55‚Üí            
    56‚Üí        except Exception as e:
    57‚Üí            print(f"Error handling client: {e}")
    58‚Üí        finally:
    59‚Üí            try:
    60‚Üí                client_socket.close()

    62‚Üí                pass
    63‚Üí            if upstream_socket:

    65‚Üí                    upstream_socket.close()
    66‚Üí                except OSError:
    67‚Üí                    pass
    68‚Üí    
    69‚Üí    def forward_messages(self, source_socket: socket.socket, dest_socket: socket.socket, direction: str):
    70‚Üí        try:
    71‚Üí            while True:
    72‚Üí                message = self.receive_message(source_socket)
    73‚Üí                if not message:
    74‚Üí                    break
    75‚Üí                
    76‚Üí                rewritten_message = self.rewrite_vibetest_addresses(message)
    77‚Üí                
    78‚Üí                self.send_message(dest_socket, rewritten_message + '\n')
    79‚Üí                
    80‚Üí        except Exception as e:
    81‚Üí            print(f"Error forwarding {direction}: {e}")
    82‚Üí        finally:
    83‚Üí            try:
    84‚Üí                source_socket.close()
    85‚Üí            except OSError:
    86‚Üí                pass
    87‚Üí            try:
    88‚Üí                dest_socket.close()
    89‚Üí            except OSError:
    90‚Üí                pass
    91‚Üí    
    92‚Üí    def rewrite_vibetest_addresses(self, message: str) -> str:
    93‚Üí        def replace_vibetest(match):
    94‚Üí            return match.group(0).replace(match.group(1), self.tony_address)
    95‚Üí        
    96‚Üí        return self.vibetest_pattern.sub(replace_vibetest, message)
    97‚Üí    
    98‚Üí    def send_message(self, socket_conn: socket.socket, message: str):
    99‚Üí        try:
   100‚Üí            socket_conn.send(message.encode('ascii'))
   101‚Üí        except (ConnectionResetError, BrokenPipeError, OSError):
   102‚Üí            pass
   103‚Üí    
   104‚Üí    def receive_message(self, socket_conn: socket.socket) -> Optional[str]:
   105‚Üí        try:
   106‚Üí            data = b''
   107‚Üí            while True:
   108‚Üí                chunk = socket_conn.recv(1)
   109‚Üí                if not chunk:
   110‚Üí                    return None
   111‚Üí                if chunk == b'\n':
   112‚Üí                    break
   113‚Üí                data += chunk
   114‚Üí            
   115‚Üí            message = data.decode('ascii').rstrip('\r')
   116‚Üí            return message
   117‚Üí        except (ConnectionResetError, BrokenPipeError, OSError, UnicodeDecodeError):
   118‚Üí            return None
   119‚Üí
   120‚Üí

   123‚Üí    proxy.start()

The issue is in the connection handling. When either the client or upstream connection disconnects, I need to properly close both sides. The current implementation has a race condition where the forwarding threads might not properly close both connections. Let me fix this:
